title: FAA Administrator Steve Dickson Expected to Resign, Officials Say; He was appointed to a five-year term by then-President Donald Trump in 2019
text:
Mr. Dickson was appointed to a five-year term by then-President Donald Trump in 2019. He took over the agency after two Boeing Co. 737 MAX jets crashed, and the FAA was facing criticism from U.S. lawmakers for its oversight of the aircraft's development.

The FAA didn't immediately respond to requests for comment late Wednesday. A spokeswoman for the Transportation Department, which oversees the agency, declined to comment.

This developing story will be updated.

Write to Andrew Tangel at Andrew.Tangel@wsj.com and Catherine Lucey at catherine.lucey@wsj.com

FAA Administrator Steve Dickson Expected to Resign, Officials Say
